#summary Mappings for special keys

= Introduction =

The below table lists all the names used for special keys (for use with keyboard.send_key or keyboard.send_keys).


|| *Keys* || *String* ||
|| LEFT || `<`left`>` ||
|| RIGHT || `<`right`>` ||
|| UP || `<`up`>` ||
|| DOWN || `<`down`>` ||
|| BACKSPACE || `<`backspace`>` ||
|| TAB || `<`tab`>` ||
|| RETURN\ENTER || `<`enter`>` ||
|| SPACE || (space character) ||
|| CONTROL || `<`ctrl`>` ||
|| ALT || `<`alt`>` ||
|| ALT_GR || `<`alt_gr`>` ||
|| SHIFT || `<`shift`>` ||
|| SUPER || `<`super`>` ||
|| CAPSLOCK || `<`capslock`>` ||
|| ESCAPE || `<`escape`>` ||
|| INSERT || `<`insert`>` ||
|| DELETE || `<`delete`>` ||
|| HOME || `<`home`>` ||
|| END || `<`end`>` ||
|| PAGE_UP || `<`page_up`>` ||
|| PAGE_DOWN || `<`page_down`>` ||
|| F1-F12 || `<`f1`>`-`<`f12`>` ||

To combine two keys use a + sign - e.g. to press Control+Esc use `<`ctrl`>`+`<`escape`>`
